topArticles.title: Lessons Learned Running Presto at Meta Scale
topArticles.description: Presto is a free, open source SQL query engine. We’ve been using it at Meta for the past ten years, and learned a lot while doing so. Running anything at scale - tools, processes, services - takes problem solving to overcome unexpected challenges. Here are four things we learned while scali
topArticles.reasoning: Direct, high-value insights from Meta's experience running Presto at immense scale, covering practical challenges and solutions in distributed data processing.

topArticles.title: What came first: the CNAME or the A record?
topArticles.description: A recent change to 1.1.1.1 accidentally altered the order of CNAME records in DNS responses, breaking resolution for some clients. This post explores the technical root cause, examines the source code of affected resolvers, and dives into the inherent ambiguities of the DNS RFCs.
topArticles.reasoning: Deep technical dive into a subtle DNS bug that caused an outage, providing excellent insights into network fundamentals, RFC interpretation, and incident root cause analysis.

topArticles.title: The Pulse: Cloudflare’s latest outage proves dangers of global configuration changes (again)
topArticles.description: Deja vu: a large Cloudflare outage caused by an instantly rolled-out global config change – two weeks after a similar problem
topArticles.reasoning: A critical analysis of a major Cloudflare outage due to global configuration changes, offering valuable lessons for release engineering and SRE best practices.

topArticles.title: Orchestrating large-scale document processing with AWS Step Functions and Amazon Bedrock batch inference
topArticles.description:
Organizations often have large volumes of documents containing valuable information that remains locked away and unsearchable. This solution addresses the need for a 
scalable, automated text extraction and knowledge base pipeline that transforms static document collections into intelligent, searcha
topArticles.reasoning: Details a scalable serverless architecture for large-scale document processing using AWS services, providing actionable insights into workflow orchestration and AI integration.

topArticles.title: Architecture for Disposable Systems
topArticles.reasoning: Explores a fundamental principle of modern, resilient system design (immutable infrastructure, ephemeral resources), crucial for scalability and operational efficiency in cloud-native environments.

topArticles.title: Downdetector and the real cost of no upstream dependencies
topArticles.description: During the Cloudflare outage, Downdetector was also unavailable. I got details from the team about why they have a hard dependency on Cloudflare, and why that won’t change anytime soon.
topArticles.reasoning: Explores the crucial topic of dependency management and its impact on system resilience, using a real-world outage as a case study for actionable insights.

topArticles.title: A closer look at a BGP anomaly in Venezuela
topArticles.description: There has been speculation about the cause of a BGP anomaly observed in Venezuela on January 2. We take a look at BGP route leaks, and dive into what the data suggests caused the anomaly in question.
topArticles.reasoning: Provides a detailed analysis of a real-world BGP anomaly, offering valuable insights into internet routing, network incidents, and global infrastructure operations.

topArticles.title: Simplify network segmentation for AWS Outposts racks with multiple local gateway routing domains
topArticles.description: AWS now supports multiple local gateway (LGW) routing domains on AWS Outposts racks to simplify network segmentation. Network segmentation is the practice of splitting a computer network into isolated subnetworks, or network segments. This reduces the attack surface so that if a host on one network
topArticles.reasoning: Explores a new AWS feature for enhancing network segmentation in hybrid cloud environments, directly relevant to cloud architecture and security best practices.

topArticles.reasoning: Provides practical, technical guidance on optimizing storage performance for Kubernetes on hybrid cloud infrastructure, directly applicable to performance engineering and cloud architecture.

topArticles.title: The Swedbank Outage shows that Change Controls don't work
topArticles.description: This week I’ve been reading through the recent judgment from the Swedish FSA on the Swedbank outage. If you’re unfamiliar with this story, Swedbank had a major outage in April 2022 that was caused by an unapproved change to their IT systems. It temporarily left nearly a million
topArticles.reasoning: Analyzes a major outage caused by failed change controls, offering critical lessons for modern SRE and DevOps practices around incident prevention and blast radius reduction.
